ratings.comment: Just straight reads off of lecture slides that he posts online so no need to go to lecture.  The one midterm was a breeze and final was very difficult and unpredictable.  I broke my hand a week before finals and he still made me write the entire final in the blue book.  Wasn't able to finish and emailed him expressing concern and he never responded

Handouts, notes and all relevant material was made available online, which I really appreciated. Final exam was a bit of a curve ball but not that far away from the practice final. Overall a good course.
Good course, dry at times but covers all the most important tools at this level. Final exam was challenging but overall fair.

No need to attend his class at all. First mid term is just same as practice exam he uploads on Aplia. Final exam is extremely time demanding and unpredictable. Do the extra credit project. It will save your letter grade. If you really want to learn something, I don't think he is your best choice for this course.
This professor does not respond to your email and never takes care of the grading mistakes. His final exam is also unreasonably complicated. You need to calculate every statistic by hand.
I'm sure he'd be a good professor for a class with more interesting material. The stuff you cover is very basic. I have some qualms with how the final was structured, but whatevs.
Very clear and clearly knowledgeable. Final exam was hard and time-intensive. Midterm was easier. Slides are very helpful. The topic is dry by its nature, so don't expect to have much fun.
He is not testing us for Stat methods. Instead, he gives you with raw data in exams so that you would find yourself more like a calculator rather than an Economist.
Good and easy professor. Take his class if you dont wannt to struggle with econ

He is a good professor, and he knows what he is talking about. He explains a lot of the course material well. He follows the book very closely and for lectures just reads off of the slideshow almost word for word. Can easily learn without going to lecture. His midterm was IDENTICAL to the practice one. Just with small changes.
